title: Lisbourg
text:
Lisbourg (; ) is a <a href="Commune%20of%20France">commune</a> in <a href="Pas-de-Calais">Pas-de-Calais</a>, <a href="Hauts-de-France">Hauts-de-France</a>, <a href="France">France</a>.
Geography.
Lisbourg is located at the source of <a href="Leie">Lys</a>, which flows northwards to <a href="Belgium">Belgium</a> and the <a href="Scheldt">Scheldt</a> estuary.
History.
The knight, Vollant de Berneville acquired the estate of Lisbourg in 1692 and was promoted to <a href="Marquise">Marquise</a> in 1694. His family ran the estate up until the <a href="French%20Revolution">French Revolution</a> and were the last Lords of Lisbourg.
Notable people.
The painter Régis Rigaux was born in Lisbourg in 1956. <a href="http%3A//www.regis-rigaux.com">His website</a>
